turns.content: Please list in bullet points all of the steps required to legally change my name and gender identification in the state of Rhode Island

Here are the general steps required to legally change your name and gender identification in Rhode Island:

Changing your Name:

1. Choose a new name that you want to use.
2. Fill out a Petition for Change of Name form, which can be obtained from the Rhode Island Family Court or downloaded from their website.
3. File the Petition with the Rhode Island Family Court in the county where you reside. You will need to pay a filing fee.
4. Attend a hearing at the Family Court. At the hearing, you will need to provide reasons for why you want to change your name and provide proof of your identity.
5. If the judge approves your name change, you will receive a signed Order Changing Name from the court. You will need to use this Order to update your name with various government agencies and other organizations.

Changing your Gender Identification:

1. Obtain a medical letter or court order that confirms your gender identity. This can be from a licensed healthcare provider or from a court order.
2. Fill out a Petition for Change of Name and Gender Identity form, which can be obtained from the Rhode Island Family Court or downloaded from their website.
3. File the Petition with the Rhode Island Family Court in the county where you reside. You will need to pay a filing fee.
4. Attend a hearing at the Family Court. At the hearing, you will need to provide proof of your identity and your medical letter or court order confirming your gender identity.
5. If the judge approves your gender identity change, you will receive a signed Order Changing Name and Gender Identity from the court. You will need to use this Order to update your gender identification with various government agencies and other organizations.
